</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Network access.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Network access costs increased $3.6&nbsp;million, or 6.0%, in 2015, as compared to 2014. The increase is primarily due
	to a
	$4.6&nbsp;million increase in depreciation expense and a $3.6&nbsp;million increase in bandwidth and other direct costs, which is inclusive of a $0.6&nbsp;million increase in costs directly
	related to our short-term DAS and Wi-Fi build-out projects. The increases were partially offset by a $4.3&nbsp;million decrease in revenue share paid to venues in our managed and operated locations,
	which included a one-time $1.9&nbsp;million cost incurred in 2014 to terminate one of our venue contracts, and a $0.3&nbsp;million decrease from customer usage at partner venues.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Network operations.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Network operations expenses increased $8.1&nbsp;million, or 31.6%, in 2015, as compared to 2014, due to a
	$3.4&nbsp;million
	increase in depreciation expense, a $1.9&nbsp;million increase in personnel related expenses primarily resulting from increased headcount, a $1.0&nbsp;million increase in network maintenance and
	connectivity expenses, a $0.4&nbsp;million increase in call center costs, a $0.3&nbsp;million increase in hardware and software maintenance expenses, and a $1.1&nbsp;million increase in other
	operating expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Development and technology.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Development and technology expenses increased $4.3&nbsp;million, or 28.7%, in 2015, as compared to 2014, due
	primarily
	to a $2.1&nbsp;million increase in depreciation expense, a $1.6&nbsp;million increase in personnel related expenses primarily resulting from increased headcount, a $0.4&nbsp;million increase in
	technology service expenses, and a $0.2&nbsp;million increase in hardware and software maintenance and other operating expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling and marketing.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling and marketing expenses increased $3.3&nbsp;million, or 20.0%, in 2015, as compared to 2014, due to a
	$1.2&nbsp;million increase in personnel related expenses primarily resulting from increased headcount, $1.4&nbsp;million one-time charge for salaries, benefits and stock-based compensation expense
	for one of our executives who was terminated, and a $0.7&nbsp;million increase in other marketing related expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General and administrative.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General and administrative expenses increased $4.9&nbsp;million, or 28.0%, in 2015, as compared to 2014,
	due to a
	$1.7&nbsp;million increase in personnel related expenses resulting from increased headcount, a $0.8&nbsp;million increase in depreciation expenses, a $0.5&nbsp;million increase in business
	licenses, taxes, and insurance, a $0.5&nbsp;million increase in consulting expenses, and a $1.4&nbsp;million increase in rent and other general and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization of intangible assets.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization of intangible assets expense remained relatively consistent in 2015, as compared to
	2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	43
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=44,EFW="2227653",CP="BOINGO WIRELESS INC",DN="1",CHK=1001226,FOLIO='43',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCV1.15ZCV78801]DK78801A.;8',USER='ABEAULI',CD=';7-MAR-2016;19:20' -->
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK78801_1_44">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227653Z10-K_HTM_BG78801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Interest and Other (Expense) Income, Net
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest and other (expense) income, net, remained relatively consistent in 2015, as compared to 2014. In 2015, we incurred and
	capitalized $0.6&nbsp;million of interest expense related to our Credit Facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Income Tax Expense
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We had income tax expense of $0.5&nbsp;million in 2015, as compared to $0.7&nbsp;million in 2014. Our effective tax rate decreased
	to 2.2% for 2015, as compared to 3.9% in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	future effective tax rate depends on various factors, such as our level of future taxable income, tax legislation and credits and the geographic compositions of our pre-tax income.
	We do not expect to incur any significant income taxes until such time that we reverse our valuation allowance against our federal and state deferred tax assets upon return to sustained profitability.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Non-controlling Interests
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Non-controlling interests decreased $0.6&nbsp;million in 2015, as compared to 2014 primarily as a result of decreased net income for
	a subsidiary resulting from the transition of the managed and operated venues of this subsidiary from an end-user paid to a tiered pricing model.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Loss Attributable to Common Stockholders
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our net loss for 2015 increased as compared to 2014 primarily as a result of the $23.9&nbsp;million increase in costs and operating
	expenses, which was partially offset by the $20.3&nbsp;million increase in revenues, the $0.6&nbsp;million decrease in net income attributable to non-controlling interests, and the
	$0.2&nbsp;million decrease in income tax expense. Our diluted net loss per share increased primarily as a result of the increase in our net loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Adjusted EBITDA
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted EBITDA was $29.6&nbsp;million in 2015, an increase of 46.0% from $20.3&nbsp;million recorded in 2014. As a percentage of
	revenue, Adjusted EBITDA was 21.2% in 2015, up from 17.0% of revenue in 2014. The Adjusted EBITDA increase was due primarily to $10.7&nbsp;million increase in depreciation and amortization expense
	and $2.2&nbsp;million increase in stock-based compensation expense. The increases were partially offset by the $2.8&nbsp;million increase in our net loss attributable to common stockholders, the
	$0.6&nbsp;million decrease in non-controlling interests, and the $0.2&nbsp;million decrease in income tax expense in 2015, as compared to 2014. We define Adjusted EBITDA as net (loss) income
	attributable to common stockholders plus depreciation and amortization of property and equipment, income tax expense, amortization of intangible assets, stock-based compensation expense,
	non-controlling interests and interest and other expense (income), net. For a discussion of Adjusted EBITDA and a reconciliation of net (loss) income attributable to common stockholders to Adjusted
	EBITDA, see footnote 1 to "Selected Financial Data" in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;6.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	44
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	*
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Calculation
	of percentage change is not meaningful.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Retail.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Retail revenue decreased $2.9&nbsp;million, or 6.6%, in 2014, as compared to 2013, primarily due to a $2.3&nbsp;million
	decrease in
	retail subscriber revenue, which was driven primarily by the decrease in retail subscribers. Our average revenue per retail subscriber remained essentially the same in 2014 as compared to 2013. The
	remaining decrease was attributable to a $0.6&nbsp;million decrease in retail single-use revenue resulting from the transition of certain paid managed and operated locations to a tiered or free
	pricing model. Retail revenue for 2014 and 2013 includes $2.3&nbsp;million and $0.4&nbsp;million, respectively, of retail single-use revenue related to venues acquired from AWG in October 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DAS.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DAS revenue increased $5.6&nbsp;million, or 17.1%, in 2014, as compared to 2013, due to a $3.3&nbsp;million
	increase from new build-out projects in our managed and operated locations and a $2.3&nbsp;million increase in access fees from our telecom operators resulting primarily from the new build-out
	projects that were completed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Wholesale&#151;Wi-Fi.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Wholesale Wi-Fi revenue decreased $2.1&nbsp;million, or 11.9%, in 2014, as compared to 2013, due to a
	$3.5&nbsp;million decrease in partner usage based fees, which was partially offset by a $0.6&nbsp;million increase in wholesale service provider revenues resulting from increased deployments and
	$0.7&nbsp;million in revenue from a Wi-Fi build-out project that was completed in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Military.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Military revenue increased $3.2&nbsp;million, or 256.0%, in 2014, as compared to 2013 due to deployments of our Wi-Fi and IPTV
	networks
	at military bases during 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Advertising and other.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Advertising and other revenue increased $8.7&nbsp;million, or 70.1%, in 2014, as compared to 2013, primarily due
	to a
	$9.3&nbsp;million increase in the volume of advertising sales at our managed and operated locations. The increase was partially offset by a $0.6&nbsp;million decrease in other revenues.
	Advertising revenue for 2014 and 2013 includes $8.2&nbsp;million and $1.1&nbsp;million, respectively, of advertising sales at the venues acquired from AWG in October 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	45
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</FONT>
	&#8203;
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Network access.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Network access costs increased $12.2&nbsp;million, or 25.8%, in 2014, as compared to 2013. The increase is primarily
	attributed to
	a $9.2&nbsp;million increase in revenue share paid to venues in our managed and operated locations, which includes a one-time $1.9&nbsp;million cost to terminate one of our venue contracts, a
	$5.4&nbsp;million increase in depreciation expense, and a $3.2&nbsp;million increase in internet connectivity expenses. The increases were partially offset by a $3.1&nbsp;million decrease from
	customer usage at partner venues and a $2.5&nbsp;million decrease in other direct costs. Other direct costs for 2014 include $0.4&nbsp;million of costs related to a Wi-Fi build out project.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Network operations.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Network operations expenses increased $7.1&nbsp;million, or 38.4%, in 2014, as compared to 2013, primarily due to a
	$3.9&nbsp;million increase in personnel related expenses, inclusive of a $0.5&nbsp;million increase in stock-based compensation expenses, primarily resulting from increased headcount, a
	$1.6&nbsp;million increase in depreciation expense, a $0.6&nbsp;million increase in network maintenance expenses, a $0.3&nbsp;million increase in travel and entertainment expenses, a
	$0.3&nbsp;million increase in hardware and software maintenance expenses, a $0.3&nbsp;million increase in call center expenses, and a $0.1&nbsp;million increase in rent and other expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Development and technology.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Development and technology expenses increased $3.4&nbsp;million, or 30.2%, in 2014, as compared to 2013,
	primarily due
	to a $1.4&nbsp;million increase in depreciation expense, a $0.7&nbsp;million increase in hardware and software maintenance expenses, a $0.4&nbsp;million impairment loss related to a change in
	the use of certain software developed for internal use, a $0.4&nbsp;million increase in technology service expenses, and a $0.5&nbsp;million increase in other operating expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling and marketing.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling and marketing expenses increased $2.1&nbsp;million, or 15.0%, in 2014, as compared to 2013, primarily due
	to a
	$3.1&nbsp;million increase in personnel related expenses, inclusive of a $1.0&nbsp;million increase in stock-based compensation expenses, primarily resulting from increased headcount and higher
	sales commissions related to our increased advertising sales. The increase was partially offset by a $1.0&nbsp;million decrease in marketing related expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General and administrative.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General and administrative expenses increased $2.4&nbsp;million, or 15.9%, in 2014, as compared to 2013,
	due to a
	$1.8&nbsp;million increase in personnel related expenses, inclusive of a $1.0&nbsp;million increase in stock- based compensation expenses, a $0.3&nbsp;million increase in consulting expenses,
	and a $0.3&nbsp;million increase in rent and facilities expenses. General and administrative expenses includes a $0.5&nbsp;million impairment loss related to a venue termination agreement that
	resulted in the abandonment of our Wi-Fi network assets and the release of the corresponding capital lease obligations associated with those assets. General and administrative expenses also includes a
	$0.8&nbsp;million decrease in the fair value of our contingent consideration liabilities related to our acquisition of Endeka Group,&nbsp;Inc. ("Endeka") in February 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	46
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=47,EFW="2227653",CP="BOINGO WIRELESS INC",DN="1",CHK=88408,FOLIO='46',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCV1.15ZCV78801]DK78801A.;8',USER='ABEAULI',CD=';7-MAR-2016;19:20' -->
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK78801_1_47">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227653Z10-K_HTM_BG78801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization of intangible assets.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amortization of intangible assets expense increased $1.5&nbsp;million, or 65.2%, in 2014, as
	compared to 2013,
	due primarily to our acquisitions of Endeka and AWG in February 2013 and October 2013, respectively. For future years, amortization expense is expected to be $3.5&nbsp;million for 2015,
	$3.5&nbsp;million for 2016, $3.2&nbsp;million for 2017, $2.4&nbsp;million for 2018, $1.6&nbsp;million for 2019 and $5.5&nbsp;million thereafter.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Interest and Other (Expense) Income, Net
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest and other (expense) income, net, decreased $0.1&nbsp;million in 2014, as compared to 2013, primarily due to our lower cash
	and cash equivalents and marketable securities balances during 2014 as compared to 2013 and interest expense related to our new Credit Agreement, which we entered into on November&nbsp;21, 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Income Tax Expense
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income tax expense decreased $0.8&nbsp;million, or 52.1%, in 2014, as compared to 2013. Our effective tax rate decreased to 3.9% for
	2014 compared to 78.7% for 2013 due primarily to the valuation allowance we established at year end in 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Non-controlling Interests
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Non-controlling interests remained essentially unchanged in 2014, as compared to 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Loss Attributable to Common Stockholders
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our net loss for 2014 increased as compared to 2013 primarily as a result of the $28.7&nbsp;million increase in costs and operating
	expenses, which was partially offset by the $12.6&nbsp;million increase in revenues and the $0.8&nbsp;million decrease in income tax expense. Our diluted net loss per share increased primarily as
	a result of the increase in our net loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Adjusted EBITDA
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted EBITDA was $20.3&nbsp;million in 2014, a decrease of 14.7% from $23.8&nbsp;million recorded in 2013. As a percentage of
	revenue, Adjusted EBITDA was 17.0% in 2014, down from 22.3% of revenue in 2013. The Adjusted EBITDA decrease was due primarily to the $15.6&nbsp;million increase in our net loss attributable to
	common stockholders and the $0.8&nbsp;million decrease in income tax expenses. The changes were offset by a $10.0&nbsp;million increase in depreciation and amortization expense and a
	$2.7&nbsp;million increase in stock-based compensation expense. We define Adjusted EBITDA as net (loss) income attributable to common stockholders plus depreciation and amortization of property and
	equipment, income tax expense, amortization of intangible assets,
	stock-based compensation expense, non-controlling interests and interest and other expense (income), net. For a discussion of Adjusted EBITDA and a reconciliation of net (loss) income attributable to
	common stockholders to Adjusted EBITDA, see footnote 1 to "Selected Financial Data" in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;6.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_RESULTS_OF_OPERATIONS>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have financed our operations primarily through cash provided by operating activities and borrowings under our credit facility. Our
	primary sources of liquidity as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 consisted of $14.7&nbsp;million of cash and cash equivalents and $31.5&nbsp;million available for borrowing under our credit facility,
	$3.6&nbsp;million of which is reserved for our outstanding Letter of Credit Authorization agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	principal uses of liquidity have been to fund our operations, working capital requirements, capital expenditures and acquisitions. We expect that these requirements will be our
	principal needs for
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	47
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=48,EFW="2227653",CP="BOINGO WIRELESS INC",DN="1",CHK=973888,FOLIO='47',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCV1.15ZCV78801]DK78801A.;8',USER='ABEAULI',CD=';7-MAR-2016;19:20' -->
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK78801_1_48">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227653Z10-K_HTM_BG78801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	liquidity
	over the near term. Our capital expenditures in 2015 were $103.1&nbsp;million, of which $57.8&nbsp;million was reimbursed through revenue for DAS build-out projects from our telecom
	operators.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	November&nbsp;21, 2014, we entered into a Credit Agreement (the "Credit Agreement") and related agreements with Bank of America, N.A. acting as agent for lenders named therein,
	including Bank of America, N.A. and Silicon Valley Bank (the "Lenders"), for a secured credit facility in the form of a revolving line of credit in the initial amount of up to $46.5&nbsp;million,
	with an option to increase the available amount to $86.5&nbsp;million upon the satisfaction of certain conditions (the "Revolving Line of Credit") and a term loan of $3.5&nbsp;million (the "Term
	Loan" and together with the Revolving Line of Credit, the "Credit Facility"). Both the Term Loan and Revolving Line of Credit mature on November&nbsp;21, 2018. Amounts borrowed under the Revolving
	Line of Credit and Term Loan will bear, at our election, a variable interest at LIBOR plus 2.5%&nbsp;-&nbsp;3.5% or Lender's Prime Rate plus 1.5%&nbsp;-&nbsp;2.5% per year and we will pay a
	fee of 0.375%&nbsp;-&nbsp;0.5% per year on any unused portion of the Revolving Line of Credit. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, $2.6&nbsp;million was outstanding under the Term Loan at a rate of
	3.3% and $15.0&nbsp;million was outstanding under the Revolving Line of Credit. The Term Loan requires quarterly payments of interest and principal, amortizing fully over the four-year-term such
	that it is repaid in full on the maturity date of November&nbsp;21, 2018. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, interest rates for our Credit Facility ranged from 2.67% to 3.33%. Repayment of
	amounts borrowed under the Credit Facility may be accelerated in the event that we are in violation of the representation,
	warranties and covenants made in the Credit Agreement, including certain financial covenants set forth therein, and under other specific default events including, but not limited to, non-payment or
	inability to pay debt, breach of cross default provisions, insolvency provisions, and change in control.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	are subject to customary covenants, including a minimum quarterly consolidated leverage ratio, a maximum quarterly consolidated fixed charge coverage ratio, and monthly liquidity
	minimums. We were in compliance with all such financial covenants as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and through the date of this report. We are subject to certain non-financial covenants, and we were
	also in compliance with all such non-financial covenants as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and through the date of this report. The Credit Facility provides us with significant additional flexibility and
	liquidity to pursue our strategic objectives for capital expenditures and acquisitions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	September&nbsp;11, 2015, we filed a shelf registration statement (the "Shelf Registration") on Form&nbsp;S-3 with the SEC that was declared effective by the SEC on
	September&nbsp;17, 2015, which permits us to offer up to $125.0&nbsp;million of common stock, preferred stock, debt securities and warrants in one or more offerings and in any combination,
	including in units from time to time. In February 2016, we filed a post-effective amendment to terminate the Shelf Registration and remove from registration the securities registered pursuant to the
	Shelf Registration. The Company's Board of Directors determined that having the Shelf Registration on file was no longer necessary due to the Company increasing the Revolving Line of Credit (see
	Note&nbsp;19 to the accompanying consolidated financial statements included in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8 hereto).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	believe that our existing cash and cash equivalents, working capital, cash flow from operations and availability under the Credit Facility will be sufficient to fund our operations
	and planned capital expenditures for at least the next 12&nbsp;months. There can be no assurance, however, that future industry-specific or other developments, general economic trends, or other
	matters will not adversely affect our operations or our ability to meet our future cash requirements. Our future capital requirements will depend on many factors including our rate of revenue growth,
	the timing and size of our managed and operated location expansion efforts, the timing and extent of spending to support product development efforts, the timing of introductions of new solutions and
	enhancements to existing solutions and the continuing market acceptance of our solutions. We expect our capital expenditures in 2016 will range from $35.0&nbsp;million to $40.0&nbsp;million,
	excluding capital expenditures for DAS build-out projects, which are reimbursed through revenue from our telecom operator customers. The majority of our 2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	48
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=49,EFW="2227653",CP="BOINGO WIRELESS INC",DN="1",CHK=852595,FOLIO='48',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCV1.15ZCV78801]DK78801A.;8',USER='ABEAULI',CD=';7-MAR-2016;19:20' -->
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK78801_1_49">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227653Z10-K_HTM_BG78801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	capital
	expenditures will be used to build out residential broadband and IPTV networks for troops stationed on military bases pursuant to our contracts with the U.S. government and upgrading our Wi-Fi
	networks at our managed and operated venues. The investment of these resources will occur in advance of experiencing any direct benefit from them including generation of revenues. The U.S. government
	may modify, curtail or terminate its contracts with us, either at its convenience or for default based on performance. Any such modification, curtailment, or termination of one or more of
	our government contracts could have a material adverse effect on our earnings, cash flow and/or financial position. We may also enter into acquisitions of complementary businesses, applications or
	technologies, which could require us to seek additional equity or debt financing. Additional funds may not be available on terms favorable to us, or at all.
</FONT>
</P>

	following table sets forth cash flow data for the periods indicated therein:

<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Cash Provided by Operating Activities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2015, we generated $98.6&nbsp;million of net cash from operating activities, an increase of $77.4&nbsp;million from 2014. The
	increase is primarily due to a $68.1&nbsp;million change in our operating assets and liabilities, a $10.7&nbsp;million increase in depreciation and amortization expenses, a $2.2&nbsp;million
	increase in stock-based compensation expenses, and a $0.7&nbsp;million change in fair value of our contingent consideration liabilities. The increases were partially offset by the
	$3.4&nbsp;million increase in our net loss and the $0.7&nbsp;million decrease in impairment losses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	2014, we generated $21.2&nbsp;million of net cash from operating activities, an increase of $0.5&nbsp;million from 2013. The increase was primarily due to a $16.6&nbsp;million
	increase in accrued expenses and other liabilities and deferred revenue in 2014 compared to a $1.9&nbsp;million decrease in 2013, a $10.0&nbsp;million increase in depreciation and amortization
	expenses in 2014, a $2.7&nbsp;million increase in stock-based compensation expenses in 2014, and a $1.0&nbsp;million impairment loss in 2014. The increases were partially offset by a
	$15.4&nbsp;million increase in our net loss including non-controlling interests from the prior year, a $9.0&nbsp;million larger increase in accounts receivable in 2014 compared to 2013, a
	$1.9&nbsp;million increase in prepaid expenses and other assets in 2014 compared to a $1.6&nbsp;million decrease in 2013, a $2.0&nbsp;million larger decrease in accounts payable in 2014 compared
	to 2013, a $1.1&nbsp;million decrease in the change in deferred tax assets, and a $0.4&nbsp;million increase in the change in fair value of contingent consideration.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	2013, we generated $20.7&nbsp;million of net cash from operating activities, a decrease of $3.9&nbsp;million from 2012. The decrease was primarily due to an $11.0&nbsp;million
	decrease in our net income including non-controlling interests from the prior year and a $1.9&nbsp;million decrease in excess windfall tax benefits from stock option exercises. The decreases were
	partially offset by a $4.1&nbsp;million increase in depreciation and amortization expenses in 2013, a $1.6&nbsp;million decrease in prepaids and other assets in 2013 compared to a
	$0.3&nbsp;million increase in prepaids and other assets in 2012, a $1.8&nbsp;million increase in stock-based compensation expenses in 2013, and a $1.2&nbsp;million smaller decrease in accrued
	expenses and other liabilities in 2013 compared to 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	49
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=50,EFW="2227653",CP="BOINGO WIRELESS INC",DN="1",CHK=95456,FOLIO='49',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCV1.15ZCV78801]DK78801A.;8',USER='ABEAULI',CD=';7-MAR-2016;19:20' -->
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DK78801_1_50">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227653Z10-K_HTM_BG78801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Cash Used in Investing Activities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2015, we used $101.5&nbsp;million in investing activities, an increase of $62.3&nbsp;million from 2014. This increase is
	primarily due to a $32.2&nbsp;million increase in purchases of property and equipment and a $29.7&nbsp;million decrease in cash provided by net proceeds from sales of marketable securities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	2014, we used $39.2&nbsp;million in investing activities, a decrease of $1.2&nbsp;million from 2013. The decrease was primarily due to a $22.8&nbsp;million increase in cash
	received from net sales of marketable securities in 2014 compared to 2013, a $19.3&nbsp;million decrease in cash used in acquisitions in 2014 compared to 2013, and a $0.5&nbsp;million decrease in
	restricted cash. The decreases were partially offset by a $41.4&nbsp;million increase in purchases of property and equipment in 2014 compared to 2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	2013, we used $40.4&nbsp;million in investing activities, a decrease of $22.1&nbsp;million from 2012. The decrease was primarily due to $8.6&nbsp;million of cash received from
	net sales of marketable securities in 2013 compared to $41.6&nbsp;million of cash used in net purchases of marketable securities in 2012. The decrease was offset by an $11.5&nbsp;million increase
	in purchases of property and equipment in 2013 compared to 2012 and $19.5&nbsp;million in net cash payments made for our acquisitions of Endeka and AWG in 2013 compared to the $3.2&nbsp;million of
	cash payments made for our acquisition of Cloud 9 in 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net Cash Provided by Financing Activities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2015, we received $8.8&nbsp;million of cash provided by financing activities compared to $0.5&nbsp;million in cash used in
	financing activities in 2014. This change is primarily due to the $11.5&nbsp;million increase in net proceeds from our Credit Facility, a $1.2&nbsp;million decrease in acquisition related
	payments, a $0.6&nbsp;million decrease in deferred financing costs, and a $0.2&nbsp;million increase in proceeds from exercise of stock options. These changes were partially offset by
	$1.6&nbsp;million of holdback consideration payments made to the previous AWG shareholders, $1.1&nbsp;million in payments to acquire the remaining non-controlling interests in Concourse
	Communications Detroit,&nbsp;LLC from the non-controlling interest owners, a $0.6&nbsp;million increase in cash used to pay federal, state, and local employment payroll taxes related to our RSUs
	that vested during the period, and $0.9&nbsp;million in repayments made on our Term Loan during 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	2014, we used $0.5&nbsp;million in financing activities, a decrease of $10.6&nbsp;million from 2013. The decrease was primarily due to $10.9&nbsp;million of cash used to repay
	notes payable and other financed liabilities that were assumed in our acquisition of Endeka and cash used to repurchase shares of our common stock in the open market in 2013 that did not recur in
	2014, $2.8&nbsp;million of proceeds received from our Credit Facility, net of deferred financing costs that were paid, and a $0.5&nbsp;million increase in proceeds from the exercise of stock
	options in 2014 compared to 2013. The decreases were partially offset by a $1.9&nbsp;million increase in cash used to pay minimum statutory taxes related to our time-based RSUs that vested during
	2014, $1.3&nbsp;million of cash used to pay continent liabilities and other acquisition related consideration during 2014, and a $0.4&nbsp;million increase in cash paid for capital leases and
	notes payable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	2013, we used $11.1&nbsp;million in financing activities compared to cash provided by financing activities of $2.1&nbsp;million in 2012. The change was primarily due to
	$6.1&nbsp;million of cash used to repay notes payable and other financed liabilities that were assumed in our acquisition of Endeka in 2013, the $4.8&nbsp;million of cash used to repurchase and
	retire approximately 722,000 shares of our common stock in the open market under our stock repurchase program at an average price per share of $6.68 in 2013, and a $2.0&nbsp;million decrease in
	proceeds from the exercise of stock options in 2013 compared to 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	50
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Payments
	under exclusive long-term, non-cancellable contracts to provide wireless communications network access to venues such as airports. Expense is
	recorded on a straight-line basis over the term of the lease.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Office
	space under non-cancellable operating leases.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Open
	purchase commitments are for the purchase of property and equipment, supplies and services. They are not recorded as liabilities on our consolidated
	balance sheet as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 as we have not received the related goods or services.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(4)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Long-term
	debt associated with our Credit Agreement with Bank of America N.A. Payments are based on contractual terms and intended timing of repayments of
	long-term debt.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(5)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Leased
	equipment, primarily for data communication and database software, under non-cancellable capital leases.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(6)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	unrecognized tax benefits are related to uncertain tax positions taken in our income tax return that would impact the effective tax rate or additional
	paid-in capital, if recognized (refer to Note&nbsp;12 to the accompanying consolidated financial statements included in Part&nbsp;II, Item&nbsp;8).
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(7)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Notes
	payable assumed in our acquisition of Endeka in 2013.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We do not have any off-balance sheet financing arrangements and we do not have any relationships with unconsolidated entities or
	financial partnerships, such as entities often referred to as structured finance or special purpose entities, which have been established for the purpose of facilitating off- balance sheet
	arrangements or other contractually narrow or limited purposes.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Transactions with Related Parties
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under our Audit Committee charter, our Audit Committee is responsible for reviewing and approving all related party transactions on a
	quarterly basis. In addition, our Board of Directors determines annually whether any related party relationships exist among the directors which would interfere with the judgment of individual
	directors in carrying out his responsibilities as director.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	51
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=52,EFW="2227653",CP="BOINGO WIRELESS INC",DN="1",CHK=235831,FOLIO='51',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCV1.15ZCV78801]DM78801A.;9',USER='ABEAULI',CD=';7-MAR-2016;19:20' -->
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM78801_1_52">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227653Z10-K_HTM_BG78801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Inflation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Inflationary factors have not had a significant effect on our performance over the past several years. A significant increase in
	inflation may affect our future performance since we may not be able to recover the increases in our costs with similar increases in our prices.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
</EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_DM78801_ITEM_7A__QUANTITATIVE_AND_QUAL__ITE02669">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DM78801_1">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;7A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are exposed to various market risks including: (i)&nbsp;interest rate risk and (ii)&nbsp;currency exchange rate risk. The risk
	of loss is assessed based on the likelihood of adverse changes in fair values, cash flows or future earnings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Interest rate risk.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Revolving Line of Credit and Term Loan bears, at the Company's election, interest at a variable interest rate of
	LIBOR plus
	2.5% - 3.5% or Lender's Prime Rate plus 1.5%&nbsp;-&nbsp;2.5% per year. The interest rate on the Term Loan resets at the end of each three month period. Our use of variable rate debt exposes us to
	interest rate risk. A 100 basis point increase in the LIBOR or Lender's Prime Rate as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 would not have a material impact on net loss and cash flow.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Foreign currency exchange rate risk.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are exposed to foreign currency exchange rate risk inherent in conducting business globally in
	numerous
	currencies, of which the most significant to our operations for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was the Brazilian Real. We are primarily exposed to foreign currency fluctuations related to the
	operations of our subsidiary in Brazil whose financial statements are not denominated in the U.S. Dollar. Our foreign operations are not material to our operations as a whole. As such, we currently do
	not enter into currency forward exchange or option contracts to hedge foreign currency exposures.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<EFX_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS>
<A NAME="FIS_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_DM78801_ITEM_8__FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS_AND_SUPPLEMENTARY_DATA">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DM78801_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Statements and Supplementary Data
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The information required by this Item is included in Part&nbsp;IV, Items&nbsp;15(a)(1) and (2)&nbsp;of this Annual Report on
	Form&nbsp;10-K.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_FINANCIAL_STATEMENTS>
<EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<A NAME="FIS_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_DM78801_ITEM_9__CHANGES_IN_AND_DISAGRE__ITE03576">

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Changes in and Disagreements with Accountants on Accounting and Financial Disclosure
<BR>

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

</P>
</EFX_ACCOUNTING_CHANGES>
<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_DM78801_ITEM_9A__CONTROLS_AND_PROCEDURES">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DM78801_4">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;9A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Controls and Procedures
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company maintains a system of disclosure controls and procedures that are designed to provide reasonable assurance that information
	required to be disclosed in the reports that the Company files or submits under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, or the Exchange Act, is processed, recorded, summarized and reported
	within the time periods specified in the Securities and Exchange Commission's rules and forms. These disclosure controls and procedures include, among other processes, controls and procedures designed
	to ensure that information required to be disclosed in the reports that the Company files or submits under the Exchange Act is accumulated and communicated to management, including our Chief Executive
	Officer and Chief Financial Officer (our principal executive officer and principal financial officer, respectively), as appropriate, to allow for timely decisions regarding required disclosure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company carried out an evaluation, under the supervision and with the participation of management, including our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, of the
	effectiveness of the design and operation of our disclosure controls and procedures as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 pursuant to Exchange Act Rule&nbsp;13a-15. Based upon that evaluation, the
	Company's Chief Executive Officer and
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	52
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=53,EFW="2227653",CP="BOINGO WIRELESS INC",DN="1",CHK=397822,FOLIO='52',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCV1.15ZCV78801]DM78801A.;9',USER='ABEAULI',CD=';7-MAR-2016;19:20' -->
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DM78801_1_53">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227653Z10-K_HTM_BG78801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Chief
	Financial Officer have concluded that the Company's disclosure controls and procedures, as defined in Exchange Act Rule&nbsp;13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e), were effective as of the end of the period
	covered by this Annual Report.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Management's Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Management is responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting at the Company. Our
	internal control over financial reporting is a process designed under the supervision of our Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer to provide reasonable assurance regarding the
	reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of the Company's financial statements for external reporting purposes in accordance with GAAP. A company's internal control over financial
	reporting includes those policies and procedures that:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of
	the assets of the Company;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	provide reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance
	with GAAP, and that receipts and expenditures of the Company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and the directors of the Company; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use or disposition of the Company's
	assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Because
	of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future
	periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	the supervision and with the participation of management, including the certifying officers, the Company conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of the Company's internal
	control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 based on the framework in
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Internal Control&#151;Integrated Framework (2013)
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO). Management's assessment included an evaluation of the design of the Company's internal control over financial
	reporting and testing of the operational effectiveness of its internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based
	on this assessment, management determined that, as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the Company maintained effective internal control over financial reporting. The registered public
	accounting firm that audited the consolidated financial statements included in this Annual Report has also issued an audit report on the Company's internal control over financial reporting. The Report
	of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm is filed with this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K in a separate section following Part&nbsp;IV, as shown on the index under Item&nbsp;15 of this
	Annual Report.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Changes in Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There have been no changes in the Company's internal control over financial reporting (as defined by Exchange Act Rule&nbsp;13a-15(f)
	and 15d-15(f)) that have materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, the Company's internal control over financial reporting during the quarter ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>

</EFX_PART_IV>
<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_FC78801_REPORT_OF_INDEPENDENT___FC702288">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_TOC_FC78801_1">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	REPORT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	To
	the Board of Directors and Stockholders of Boingo Wireless,&nbsp;Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	our opinion, the accompanying consolidated balance sheets and the related consolidated statements of operations, comprehensive income (loss), stockholders' equity and cash flows
	present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of Boingo Wireless,&nbsp;Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Company") at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, and the results of their
	operations and their cash flows for each of the
	three years in the period ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America. Also in our opinion, the Company maintained, in
	all material respects, effective internal control over financial reporting as of December&nbsp;31, 2015, based on criteria established in
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Internal
	Control&#151;Integrated Framework (2013)
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO). The Company's management is responsible
	for these financial statements, for maintaining effective internal control over financial reporting and for its assessment of the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting, included
	in Management's Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting appearing under Item&nbsp;9A. Our responsibility is to express opinions on these financial statements and on the Company's
	internal control over financial reporting based on our integrated audits. We conducted our audits in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States).
	Those standards require that we plan and perform the audits to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the financial statements are free of material misstatement and whether effective internal
	control over financial reporting was maintained in all material respects. Our audits of the financial statements included examining, on a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in
	the financial statements, assessing the accounting principles used and significant estimates made by management, and evaluating the overall financial statement presentation. Our audit of internal
	control over financial reporting included obtaining an understanding of internal control over financial reporting, assessing the risk that a material weakness exists, and testing and evaluating the
	design and operating effectiveness of internal control based on the assessed risk. Our audits also included performing such other procedures as we considered necessary in the circumstances. We believe
	that our audits provide a reasonable basis for our opinions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
	company's internal control over financial reporting is a process designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of
	financial statements for external purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles. A company's internal control over financial reporting includes those policies and procedures
	that (i)&nbsp;pertain to the maintenance of records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the transactions and dispositions of the assets of the company; (ii)&nbsp;provide
	reasonable assurance that transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of financial statements in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that receipts and
	expenditures of the company are being made only in accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the company; and (iii)&nbsp;provide reasonable assurance regarding prevention or
	timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use, or disposition of the company's assets that could have a material effect on the financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Because
	of its inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not prevent or detect misstatements. Also, projections of any evaluation of effectiveness to future
	periods are subject to the risk that controls may become inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	/s/
	PricewaterhouseCoopers&nbsp;LLP
<BR>
	Los Angeles, California
<BR>
	March&nbsp;11, 2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-2
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>

	&#8203;

<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FO78801_1_8">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227653Z10-K_HTM_BG78801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_FO78801_BOINGO_WIRELESS,_INC__NOTES_TO__BOI04603">
</A>
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_TOC_FO78801_1">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Boingo Wireless,&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
<BR>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
<BR>
	(In thousands, except shares and per share amounts)
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	1. The business
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Boingo Wireless,&nbsp;Inc. and its subsidiaries (collectively "we, "us", "our" or "the Company") is a leading global provider of wireless connectivity solutions for smartphones,
	tablets, laptops, wearables, internet of things ("IoT") and other wireless-enabled consumer devices. Boingo Wireless,&nbsp;Inc. was incorporated in April&nbsp;16, 2001 in the State of Delaware. We
	have a diverse monetization model that enables us to generate revenues from wholesale partnerships, retail sales, and advertising across these wireless networks. Wholesale offerings include Wi-Fi
	roaming, value-added services, private label Wi-Fi, location based services, and distributed antenna systems ("DAS") or femto-cells, which are cellular extension networks. Retail products include
	Wi-Fi subscriptions and day passes that provide access to more than 1.5&nbsp;million commercial hotspots worldwide, and broadband and TV services for troops living in Army, Air Force and Marines
	bases. Advertising revenue is driven by Wi-Fi sponsorships at airports, hotels, cafes and restaurants, and public spaces. Our customers include some of the world's largest carriers, telecommunications
	service providers and global consumer brands, as well as Internet savvy consumers on the go and troops stationed at military bases.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	2. Summary of significant accounting policies
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Basis of presentation and consolidation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United
	States of America ("GAAP").
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	accompanying consolidated financial statements include our accounts and the accounts of our majority owned subsidiaries. We consolidate our 70% ownership of Chicago Concourse
	Development Group,&nbsp;LLC and our 75% ownership of Boingo Holding Participacoes&nbsp;Ltda. in accordance with Financial Accounting Standards Board ("FASB") Accounting Standards Codification
	("ASC") 810,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Consolidation
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	. Other parties' interests in consolidated entities are reported as non-controlling interests. All intercompany balances and
	transactions have been eliminated in consolidation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior
	to August&nbsp;4, 2015, we had a 70% ownership of Concourse Communications Detroit,&nbsp;LLC. On August&nbsp;4, 2015, we purchased the remaining 30% ownership interest from
	the non-controlling interest owners for $1,150. We accounted for this transaction as an acquisition of the remaining interest of an entity that had already been majority-owned by the Company. The
	purchase resulted in a reduction to additional paid-in capital of $1,150 representing excess purchase price over the carrying amount of the non-controlling interests. Prior to this purchase, we had a
	controlling interest in this subsidiary, and therefore, this subsidiary had been and will continue to be consolidated with the Company's operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	early adopted FASB Accounting Standards Update, ("ASU") 2015-17,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, on a retrospective
	basis as of December&nbsp;31, 2015. As a result of this adoption, the consolidated balance sheet as of December&nbsp;31, 2014 has been revised to reflect reclassifications of $787 from current
	deferred tax assets to noncurrent deferred tax liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, the Company recorded certain out-of-period adjustments that decreased net loss attributable to common stockholders by $217. The impact of
	these out-of-period adjustments is not considered material, individually and in the aggregate, to any of the current or prior annual periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-8
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=64,EFW="2227653",CP="BOINGO WIRELESS INC",DN="1",CHK=780765,FOLIO='F-8',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCV1.15ZCV78801]FO78801A.;9',USER='ABEAULI',CD=';7-MAR-2016;19:27' -->
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FO78801_1_9">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227653Z10-K_HTM_BG78801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Boingo Wireless,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(In thousands, except shares and per share amounts)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	2. Summary of significant accounting policies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Use of estimates
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The preparation of accompanying consolidated financial statements in conformity with GAAP requires us to make estimates and assumptions
	that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and the disclosure of contingent assets and liabilities at the dates of the accompanying consolidated financial statements, and the reported
	amounts of revenue and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could differ from those estimates. Assets and liabilities which are subject to significant judgment and the use of estimates
	include the allowance for doubtful accounts, recoverability of goodwill and long-lived assets, valuation allowances with respect to deferred tax assets, uncertain tax positions, useful lives
	associated with property and equipment, valuation and useful lives of intangible assets, valuation of contingent consideration, and the valuation and assumptions underlying stock-based compensation
	and other equity instruments. On an ongoing basis, we evaluate our estimates compared to historical experience and trends, which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying value of assets
	and liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Concentrations of credit risk
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial instruments that potentially subject us to significant concentrations of credit risk consist primarily of cash and cash
	equivalents, marketable securities and accounts receivable. We maintain our cash and cash equivalents and marketable securities with institutions with high credit ratings. We extend credit based upon
	the evaluation of the customer's
	financial condition and generally collateral is not required. We maintain an allowance for doubtful accounts based upon expected collectability of accounts receivable. We primarily estimate our
	allowance for doubtful accounts based on a specific review of significant outstanding accounts receivable. For the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, one customer accounted for 17% and 15%
	of total revenue, respectively. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, two customers each accounted for 14% of total revenue. At December&nbsp;31, 2015, four customers accounted for 28%, 19%,
	19% and 10% of the total accounts receivable, respectively. At December&nbsp;31, 2014, two customers accounted for 30% and 17% of the total accounts receivable, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cash and cash equivalents
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash and cash equivalents include highly liquid investments that are readily convertible into known amounts of cash with original
	maturities of three months or less when acquired. At December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, cash equivalents consisted of money market funds.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Marketable securities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our marketable securities consist of available-for-sale securities with original maturities exceeding three months. In accordance with
	FASB ASC 320,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Investments&#151;Debt and Equity Securities
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, we have classified securities, which have readily determinable fair values and are
	highly liquid, as short-term because such securities are expected to be realized within a one-year period. At December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, we had $0 and $1,614, respectively, in marketable
	securities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Marketable
	securities are reported at fair value with the related unrealized gains and losses reported as other comprehensive income (loss) until realized or until a determination is
	made that an
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-9
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=65,EFW="2227653",CP="BOINGO WIRELESS INC",DN="1",CHK=88995,FOLIO='F-9',FILE='DISK129:[15ZCV1.15ZCV78801]FO78801A.;9',USER='ABEAULI',CD=';7-MAR-2016;19:27' -->
<A NAME="A2227653Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FO78801_1_10">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2227653Z10-K_HTM_BG78801A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Boingo Wireless,&nbsp;Inc.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(In thousands, except shares and per share amounts)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	2. Summary of significant accounting policies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	other-than-temporary
	decline in market value has occurred. No significant unrealized gains and losses have been reported during the years presented. Factors considered by us in assessing whether an
	other-than-temporary impairment has occurred include the nature of the investment, whether the
	decline in fair value is attributable to specific adverse conditions affecting the investment, the financial condition of the investee, the severity and the duration of the impairment and whether we
	have the ability to hold the investment to maturity. When it is determined that an other-than-temporary impairment has occurred, the investment is written down to its market value at the end of the
	period in which it is determined that an other-than-temporary decline has occurred. The cost of marketable securities sold is based upon the specific identification method. Any realized gains or
	losses on the sale of investments are reflected as a component of interest and other (expense) income, net.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013, we had no significant realized or unrealized gains or losses from investments in marketable securities classified as
	available-for-sale. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, we had no unrealized gains or losses in accumulated other comprehensive income (loss).
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Fair value of financial instruments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Fair value is defined as the price that would be received from selling an asset, or paid to transfer a liability, in an orderly
	transaction between market participants at the measurement date. When determining the fair value measurements for assets and liabilities required or permitted to be recorded at fair value, we consider
	the principal or most advantageous market in which it would transact, and we consider assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or liability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	accounting guidance for fair value measurement also requires an entity to maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs when measuring fair value.
	The standard establishes a fair value hierarchy based on the level of independent, objective evidence surrounding the inputs used to measure fair value. A financial instrument's categorization within
	the fair value hierarchy is based upon the lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement. The fair value hierarchy is as
	follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;1&#151;Unadjusted quoted prices in active markets that are accessible at the measurement date for identical,
	unrestricted assets or liabilities.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;2&#151;Quoted prices for identical assets and liabilities in markets that are not active, quoted prices for
	similar assets and liabilities in active markets or financial instruments for which significant inputs are observable, either directly or indirectly.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;3&#151;Unobservable inputs that are supported by little or no market activity and that are significant to the fair
	value of the assets or liabilities.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	carrying amount reflected in the accompanying consolidated balance sheets for cash and cash equivalents, restricted cash, marketable securities, accounts receivable, prepaid expenses
	and other current assets, accounts payable, accrued expenses and other liabilities approximates fair value due to the short-term nature of these financial instruments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	F-10
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
